test.name: Caso de teste 01 - Desafio tecnico ID Check

kw.name: Open Browser
kw.doc: Opens a new browser instance to the optional ``url``.
kw.msg: Opening browser ' chrome' to base url 'None'.

kw.name: Maximize Browser Window
kw.doc: Maximizes current browser window.

kw.name: Go To
kw.doc: Navigates the current browser window to the provided ``url``.

kw.name: Click Element
kw.doc: Click the element identified by ``locator``.

kw.name: Execute Javascript
kw.doc: Executes the given JavaScript code with possible arguments.
kw.msg: Executing JavaScript: window.scrollTo(0,1500) Without any arguments.

kw.name: Wait Until Element Is Visible
kw.doc: Waits until the element ``locator`` is visible.

kw.name: Input Text
kw.doc: Types the given ``text`` into the text field identified by ``locator``.

kw.name: Wait Until Element Is Enabled
kw.doc: Waits until the element ``locator`` is enabled.

kw.name: Click Element
kw.doc: Click the element identified by ``locator``.

kw.name: Switch Window
kw.doc: Switches to browser window matching ``locator``.

kw.name: Verificar que o CEP não existe
Wait Until Element Is Visible
kw.doc: Waits until the element ``locator`` is visible.

kw.name: Element Text Should Be
kw.doc: Verifies that element ``locator`` contains exact the text ``expected``.
kw.msg: Keyword 'Element Text Should Be' found both from a custom library 'SeleniumLibrary' and a standard library 'XML'. The custom keyword is used. To select explicitly, and to get rid of this warning, use either 'SeleniumLibrary.Element Text Should Be' or 'XML.Element Text Should Be'.
Verifying element 'id=mensagem-resultado-alerta' contains exact text 'Dados não encontrado'.

test.doc: Este teste verifica não encontrar um cep invalido no site dos correios
